items.preText:
12pm Here we go... Ashik: "Welcome to All of Fans who support BD and Zim both of team. Its a great sunny day in here Dhaka. So we expect we are going to see an exciting match today. Good Luck Both Of Team."

Pranand: "Must win for ZIM as last match but its difficult"

Zimbabwe are continuing with the same line-up; Bangladesh have made one change, bringing back Sunzamul Islam to replace Mohammad Saifuddin.
Cremer: Not sure actually [if we'd have batted first]. There's a lot more moisture than before. We were leaning towards bowling first. It is just that variable bounce that I have to wait and see. I thought the wicket was tough last game, but could have got there towards the end.

Mortaza: Looks to be a very good wicket. The sun is out and obviously the way we batted against Sri Lanka, hopefully we'll do it again. Last two and a half years our fast bowlers have been doing well, save South Africa. It's important to come back and they've been working hard the last few weeks. Momentum is very important in ODIs and T20s so we're trying to keep the momentum.

11:33am Bangladesh have won the toss and elected to bat.
 For a more detailed picture of the match, head over here to read Mohammad Isam's preview: Zimbabwe need remedy for frail middle order

11:18am Good morning and welcome to our coverage of the fifth match of this tri-series. It's Zimbabwe's last one, and you'd think they must win it if they want to be part of the final on Saturday. Bangladesh, with their two bonus point wins, are already a certainty. Can they keep the form up or will Zimbabwe spring another surprise? A loss means they'd have to count on Bangladesh beating Sri Lanka in their next match, and then we'll have to get into the mathematics of the table. Remember, Zimbabwe are currently second on net run rate.
items.text: length ball wide outside off, left alone
items.shortText: Jarvis to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: beats the outside edge with some swing. Wobbles in and then out as he reaches out away from the body for a cover drive. A puff of dust as that hits the surface, in the first over itself
items.shortText: Jarvis to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: length on middle stump, punched back to the bowler on the up
items.shortText: Jarvis to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: short ball slanted across off stump, hangs the bat out aimlessly and is beaten
items.shortText: Jarvis to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: good length and down leg side, closes the face too early on the flick and it rolls into the off side
items.shortText: Jarvis to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: overpitched outside off stump, gets to the pitch and drills it between non-striker and mid-off
items.shortText: Jarvis to Tamim Iqbal, FOUR runs

items.preText: Chatara from the other end, starting with a slip
items.text: back of a length and swinging away wildly, way outside off. Batsman doesn't go after that
items.shortText: Chatara to Anamul Haque, 1 wide

items.text: good length and just outside off, defended solidly on the front foot
items.shortText: Chatara to Anamul Haque, no run

items.text: good length and bending away outside off again, left alone. This was marginal, could have been called wide
items.shortText: Chatara to Anamul Haque, no run

items.text: inswinger starts outside off and traps him on the pad as he looks to flick across the line. But he has gotten outside off stump and is safe
items.shortText: Chatara to Anamul Haque, no run

items.text: short of a length and skidding straight outside off, left alone
items.shortText: Chatara to Anamul Haque, no run

items.text: 123kph, good length and shaping in at the corridor. Defended on the front foot
items.shortText: Chatara to Anamul Haque, no run

items.text: good length and wide outside off. Reaches out again with a stride and clips this across the line to deep square
items.postText: Rafizur: "Zimbabwe has a great chance to be in the final, must win game for them. As a Bangladeshi i don't want them to beat us but good luck to you fellas. "
items.shortText: Chatara to Anamul Haque, 1 run

items.text: plumb! Beaten on the inside edge as he plonks the front leg across yet again. This length ball pitches in the corridor and nips back in. He's caught playing the wrong line and is struck dead in front of off stump. No doubt about that, and his partner tells him
items.shortText: Jarvis to Anamul Haque, OUT

dismissal.text: Anamul Haque lbw b Jarvis 1 (7b 0x4 0x6) SR: 14.28

items.preText: Two slips and a wide gully for Shakib.
items.text: short of a length across the corridor. Dabs it into the off side with an angled bat
items.shortText: Jarvis to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.text: outside edge sails over gully and trickles to third man. Length ball going across him and he chases it with hard hands, away from the body
items.shortText: Jarvis to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

items.text: back of a length in the corridor, he shapes to defend but withdraws the bat at the last moment to let it through
items.shortText: Jarvis to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: full and just outside off, driven to mid-off from the toe-end of the game
items.shortText: Jarvis to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: slower ball on a good length, just outside off stump. Defended to point on the front foot
items.postText: TareQ: "Now that's going to be a real test for Shakib al hasan when he come down the crease at 3rd over. Long way to play.
items.shortText: Jarvis to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: slides this length ball down leg side, Shakib leaves
items.shortText: Chatara to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 wide

items.text: good length and big swing into the left hander. He's unable to control the swing. This is deflected behind square leg off the pad
items.shortText: Chatara to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 leg bye

items.text: good length and shaping in at off stump, blocked on the front foot
items.shortText: Chatara to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: flicks aerially but it's wide of midwicket. Full and coming into the pads and he reaches out well in front of the body. Not in control there
items.shortText: Chatara to Tamim Iqbal, 2 runs

items.text: good length and in at off stump, defended on the front foot
items.shortText: Chatara to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: back of a length and coming into the pads, dabbed through square leg off the back foot
items.shortText: Chatara to Tamim Iqbal, 1 run
